medical_history.chief_complaint: Waxing and waning pulmonary lesions several years after treatment for seminoma.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until five years prior when diagnosed with left testicular seminoma. Following treatment, symptoms began with a nonproductive cough reported at a follow-up visit one year after radiation therapy. After two years post-treatment, he noted pain and edema in both legs and bouts of exertional dyspnea. Over time, multiple pulmonary nodules developed, some of which waxed and waned in size.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of left testicular seminoma treated with left radical orchiectomy and radiation therapy. Chronic heartburn and scoliosis treated with Harrington rod placement 16 years prior.
medical_history.family_history: Brother and mother had renal cancer; mother also had breast cancer. A grandfather had gastric cancer, and a grandmother had an unspecified cancer.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is an executive who drinks moderate amounts of alcohol and does not smoke.
